summary.p: There is little to write, as Bucer remains calm; Zwick hopes that the conflict does not break out again. Recommends a Jewish convert [Michael Adam]. Greetings.

div.p: I see that there is no occasion left for us to write to each other, now that Bucer has begun to remain somewhat calm, and certainly this silence is fortunate. I wish that we do not fall back into these miserable conflicts for any reason!

Indeed, I have nothing else to write except what I have written to Pellicanus about the Hebrew, whom I also commend to you. For unless I am completely mistaken, he is steadfast in the faith of Christ.
Farewell with perpetual health along with your mother, wife, children, and all good people. July 7, 1538.
To Lord Heinrich Bullinger, my dearest brother in the Lord.
